STM: Struggling with introductory computer science course; finding coding assignments particularly challenging.
Overwhelmed by the amount of homework and the pace of college life.

MTM.Summary: Adjusting to the rigor of college coursework.
MTM.Patterns: difficulty with computer science, overwhelmed by workload, struggles with coding assignments
MTM.Goals: improve coding skills, better time management, find study groups
MTM.Transition: Learning to navigate academic challenges and seeking resources for support.

LTM.Milestone: Started college education, marking transition to higher academics.
LTM.Implications: Beginning of professional development and career exploration.
LTM.Lessons: Academic rigor increase, adaptation needed, new study habits required.

short_term: Join a coding bootcamp or workshop
Secure an internship related to computer science
long_term: Develop a portfolio of personal coding projects
Achieve a significant role or leadership position in tech

STM: Feeling disconnected from high school friends; college life seems to have changed social dynamics quickly.
Attempting to make new friends in class and through dorm social events, though feeling out of place at times.
Awkward interactions with roommate; difficulty adjusting to shared living spaces.

MTM.Summary: Navigating new social dynamics in college.
MTM.Patterns: feeling disconnected from old friends, difficulty making new friends, awkwardness with roommate
MTM.Goals: build new friendships, improve communication with roommate, find social balance
MTM.Transition: Adapting to new living arrangements and evolving relationships.

short_term: Attend campus social events to meet new people
Set up regular meetups with old friends
long_term: Cultivate a close-knit group of friends for emotional support
Establish a stable, harmonious living situation

STM: Experiencing existential crises and feelings of inadequacy, especially late at night.
Not getting enough sleep due to early classes and late-night disturbances in the dorm.

MTM.Summary: Facing existential crises and sleep deprivation.
MTM.Patterns: late-night anxiety, sleep issues due to environment, existential questioning
MTM.Goals: improve sleep quality, find mental peace, address feelings of inadequacy
MTM.Transition: Learning to manage stress and prioritize mental health.

long_term: Develop a sustainable routine for mental health maintenance
Achieve a balanced lifestyle between work and relaxation

STM: Realizing the cost of living in NYC, particularly with small daily expenses like coffee.
Feeling broke due to the unexpected expenses and lack of income while in college.

MTM.Summary: Realizing the financial realities of college life.
MTM.Patterns: unexpected expenses, cost of living awareness, feeling broke
MTM.Goals: create a budget, seek part-time work, manage daily expenses
MTM.Transition: Becoming more financially aware and planning for future stability.

short_term: Create and follow a monthly budget
Find a part-time job or freelance work
long_term: Save for postgraduate education or professional development
Build an emergency fund for financial stability

STM: Questioning life decisions and feeling like many students might be pretending to have their life together.
